question: Are we born with the H Pylori bacteria in our stomach?
question_content: Does everyone have H pylori? Is it a bad bacteria?

answers.answer_content:
H.Pylori does not reside in all peoples stomach.As a part normal flora it can be in mucosa of the stomach of many people.
H.pylori has been shown to play an important role in stomach ulcers & even a risk factor for development of some stomach cancers.
Here are  results of some studies----
# Presence of infection with H.pylori is an important risk factor for development of  ulcers.
# Cure of infection results in a dramatic decrease in the rate of ulcer relapse. (from about 80% to 15% in the first year.)
No, H pylori is not a probiotic found in the intestinal track. Its a horrible bacteria because it causes stomach cancer.

No everyone does not have it and yes it can be bad as it increases your risk for stomach cancer.
